to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
surname Wang
to rule/to reign over
hands joined
to practice fraud (idiom); by trickery

to play with/to toy with/to dally with/to engage in/to resort to
to move back and forth/to fiddle with
(dialect) alley/lane
to tease
to make a fool out of/to fool/to dupe
to fool/to deceive/to go through the motions
to make dirty/to defile/to smear

sentences.english: He got all the big scoops for the paper.
sentences.chinese: 他爲本報弄到所有的頭號獨家新聞。

sentences.english: At midnight my brother and nephew went to get fuel.
sentences.chinese: 大半夜裏，我哥哥和外甥去弄燃油。

sentences.english: The crabs broke this thin net at the first time.
sentences.chinese: 下第一次籠子之後螃蟹就將這個細網子弄破了。

sentences.english: Frank, how about some bacon with your French toast ?
sentences.chinese: 弗蘭克，弄點兒鹹肉就着煎麪包片兒喫好不好？

sentences.english: The couple had a heck of an argument and kept us awake all night.
sentences.chinese: 爭得夠嗆，弄得咱們一晚上沒眨眼皮。

sentences.english: Aeriform lieutenant general does group of relations intimately to be done aloof and tensely originally.
sentences.chinese: 無形中將原本親密的幹羣關係弄得疏遠而緊張了。

sentences.english: The child was frightened by the hedgehog. The father rolled it out of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 孩子被這隻刺猥嚇壞了，父親把它從花園裏弄了出去。

sentences.english: A: Make sure you get the book in Beijing for me. It’s important.
sentences.chinese: 你一定要在北就給我弄到那本書，很重要。

sentences.english: It is very often nothing but our own vanity that deceives us.
sentences.chinese: 我們往往會因爲我們自己的虛榮心，而給弄迷了心竅。

sentences.english: You must get a permit if you want to keep a gun.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想持有一支槍，你必須弄一張許可證。

sentences.english: They have vulgarized many of the loveliest spots in our country.
sentences.chinese: 他們把我國許多最美的旅遊勝地弄得庸俗不堪。

sentences.english: This praise and confidence smote Dobbin's heart very keenly.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的誇獎和信賴弄得都賓十分不好意思。

sentences.english: Though fortune does be pleasing I 'll go along with you.
sentences.chinese: 我心傷悲，命運弄人，與汝同殤。

sentences.english: Up to your preference, if you want to make the background a little more purple.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想把背景弄得更紫一點，可根據需要而定。

sentences.english: They have toughened things up recently at the school.
sentences.chinese: 最近他們在學校裏把事情弄得很僵了。

definition: to do/to make/to go in for/to set up/to get hold of/to take care of
to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
lanes and alleys/neighborhood/lane neighborhoods in parts of Shanghai, with modified Chinese courtyard houses, occupied by single families in the 1930s, now crowded with multiple families
to move (things around)/to buy and sell at a profit (derog.)
to toss from side to side (e.g. sleeplessly)/to repeat sth over and over again/to torment sb/to play crazy/to squander (time, money)
confused and disoriented
to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
to get hold of/to obtain/to secure/to come by
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
to put in order/to tidy up/to pack/to repair/(coll.) to sort sb out/to fix sb
otherwise/or else/or
this time
everything in disorder (idiom); in a hideous mess/at sixes and sevens
not so/no/or else/otherwise/if not/How about ...?
(coll.) if
